description.narrative: The Capacity for Research and Advocacy for Fair Taxation (CRAFT) in Nigeria is a part of a worldwide project that was implemented in 2012 as a component of the NEITI project. It is aimed at consolidating the outcomes achieved in 2012 and establish tax structure in the informal sector. The CRAFT project has been developed through collaboration between Oxfam Novib and partners with a view to achieve accountable, fair and pro-poor tax systems. Within this project the partners (in particular in Nigeria, Mali, Senegal, Ghana, Egypt and Bangladesh) are trained to improve their research and advocacy skills and they meet each other twice a year during strategy meetings. So far the project has accumulated a vast amount of research and policy documents and has supported public and private policy work. More information about the project can be found on: www.maketaxfair.net

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novibs main office is based in The Netherlands, itsupports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fund raising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s head office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
